image.altText: A man in a suit and tie.

items.synopsis: The ex-husband of a former owner of a Canberra lobbying firm has used parliamentary privilege to make explosive claims that it planned to offer kickbacks to former Liberal minister Stuart Robert in return for support to win contracts.

title.children: Lobbying firm allegedly planned to funnel money to Stuart Robert in return for favours, former employee claims

image.altText: Steve Smith plays a full-blooded cover drive

items.synopsis: England quick Josh Tongue takes the wickets of Usman Khawaja and David Warner as the hosts fight back on day one of the second Ashes Test at Lord's. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Smith and Labuschagne take the fight to England on day one of Lord's Test

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Robinson roars in delight, Marnus hangs around for a bit, but then trudges off very, very slowly. It was a clear edge though, albeit a thin one. Marnus goes for 47 off 93 balls. England finally has the breakthrough.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: EDGED! MARNUS IS OUT!

children.content: Robinson roars in delight, Marnus hangs around for a bit, but then trudges off very, very slowly.
It was a clear edge though, albeit a thin one.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A brilliant session for Australia, with just that early wicket of David Warner for 66 to fall. Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne, after a very scratchy start by the latter, are going at a decent clip now and look really set in their innings. Their drives are flowing and the bowling isn't exactly challenging them right now.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: TEA: Australia 2-190 (Labuschagne 45, Smith 38)

props.alt: Ben Stokes charges after a ball in the field during a Test.

children.content: A brilliant session for Australia, with just that early wicket of David Warner for 66 to fall.

Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne, after a very scratchy start by the latter, are going at a decent clip now and look really set in their innings. Their drives are flowing and the bowling isn't exactly challenging them right now.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: That is a terrific ball from Tongue! It has swung a mile in to Warner and his face betrayed that he knew he was beaten almost before the ball cannoned into the stumps. Warner goes for an at times fortunate 66 off 88 balls, punctuated with his normal attacking brilliance.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: BOWLED HIM! WARNER HAS TO GO!

children.content: That is a terrific ball from Tongue!
It has swung a mile in to Warner and his face betrayed that he knew he was beaten almost
before the ball cannoned into the stumps.
Warner goes for an at times fortunate 66 off 88 balls, punctuated with his normal attacking brilliance.

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

items.synopsis: The latest monthly consumer price indicator shows inflation fell sharply to 5.6 per cent over the 12 months to May, down from 6.8 per cent in April.

title.children: Inflation falls sharply, 'soft enough to see the RBA halt' rate rises

image.altText: Picture of Australian one dollar coins stacked on top of note currency

items.synopsis: With interest rate rises and years of slow wage growth, Canberrans are talking about how they're going to keep a roof over their heads. Yesterday's ACT budget aimed to address that issue, but the territory government's promises rely on federal support.

title.children: ACT government knows the cost of living is hurting Canberrans, but it needs Commonwealth help to fix it

image.altText: A serious young woman, red hair tied up, pink jumper, holds a baby with ribbon in red hair, fridge behind, with magnets.

items.synopsis: A year after dozens of women launched a complaint about their treatment while giving birth at this regional hospital, more are coming forward to share their "traumatic" experiences.

title.children: Natalie felt like she was being 'tortured' while giving birth. Now the hospital is under scrutiny

image.altText: A graphic showing a piggy bank with coins, notes and gold dollar signs going into or out of it.

items.synopsis: The Parliamentary Budget Office releases a sophisticated "build your own budget" interactive.

title.children: Think you could be treasurer? Try this 'build your own budget' interactive

image.altText: A baby wearing a white headband receives kisses on the cheek from her mother and father on each side.

items.synopsis: South Koreans become a year or two younger today as new laws that require using only the international method of counting age take effect, replacing the country's traditional method.

title.children: South Koreans become one year younger today

image.altText: A dark picture of a black man wearing a black top, against a dark background.

items.synopsis: Actor Idris Elba describes his latest TV series Hijack as "pure escapism" as he continues to challenge audience expectations throughout his successful career.

title.children: 'Pure escapism': Idris Elba challenges audience expectations in new Hijack show

image.altText: Arisa Trew on a skating ramp wearing a pink helmet with her arms spread out standing on an angle on a skateboard.

items.synopsis: The 13-year-old Olympic hopeful nailed the trick made famous by Tony Hawk in front of the skateboarding legend himself.

title.children: Gold Coast teen Arisa Trew becomes the first female to land a 720 in competition

image.altText: A woman wearing a white headscarf looks through various belongings.

items.synopsis: A 13-year-old Kurdish girl went missing on her way home, after being approached by a man. Her parents immediately feared the worst — that she had been persuaded to join an armed group and was taken to one of its training camps.

title.children: Child soldiers on the rise in Syria even as fighting subsides

image.altText: Man stands on a street in front of a shop and restaurant destroyed by a Russian missile attack

items.synopsis: A Russian missile strike on a busy restaurant in the city of Kramatorsk in eastern Ukraine has killed at least 11 people and injured dozens.

title.children: 11 people dead, including three teenagers, after Russian missile strike on Ukrainian restaurant

image.altText: A headshot of a young woman with blonde hair looking off camera

items.synopsis: A Belgian tourist missing in Tasmania is described as an "inexperienced hiker", as police continue to search a forest where she is thought to have become lost days ago.

title.children: Weather 'challenging' efforts to find missing Belgian tourist in Tasmania

image.altText: Bill Shorten at a press conference

items.synopsis: Stressing that no current NDIS participants will be removed from the scheme, NDIS Minister Bill Shorten says reforms to the scheme may lead to fewer future entrants with psychosocial disability, as the government seeks to curb growth by 27,000 over the next few years.

title.children: Fewer people with psychosocial disability may be added to NDIS, as minister flags 27,000 to be diverted under reforms

image.altText: A mural of SA Police officers.

items.synopsis: A new mural in Adelaide's CBD depicting two police officers on duty has been labelled a "misstep" by a state MP.

title.children: Mural in Adelaide's CBD labelled 'misstep' as SA Police refuse to outline cost

image.altText: A parked car on fire with flames and smoke coming out late at night in France

items.synopsis: A 17-year-old boy who worked as a delivery driver is shot dead by police during a traffic stop, sparking anger and unrest.

title.children: 'Unexplainable and inexcusable': Macron lays into police after teen shot dead and Paris riots

image.altText: Hans Niemann

items.synopsis: A US federal court judge rejects Hans Niemann's claims Magnus Carlsen and Chess.com broke antitrust laws by colluding to exclude him from lucrative tournaments.

title.children: US court dismisses Hans Niemann's $150m defamation lawsuit against fellow chess star Magnus Carlsen

items.synopsis: A young woman who spat at and punched staff at the Hindley Street McDonald's in Adelaide's CBD in October has been sentenced to an 18-month good-behaviour bond.

title.children: 'Maccas spitter' first person to be sentenced under harsher retail assault laws in SA

image.altText: Road workers stand on an empty highway cordoned off with traffic cones.

items.synopsis: A teenage girl is under police guard in hospital after allegedly being behind the wheel of a crash in northern Victoria that has left a female passenger dead.

title.children: Charges expected to be laid after 14yo female driver is allegedly involved in fatal collision

image.altText: An orca jumps out of the ocean with mountains in the background

items.synopsis: A pod of orcas swims into the bay at Merimbula, including one that has been sighted on and off for 20 years.

title.children: 'Holy grail' of whale watching captured right next to the NSW coastline

image.altText: A close-up of a man's face as he leaves court

items.synopsis: Dylan Brown was charged with five counts of sexual touching without consent. In court today, he pleaded guilty to two of the charges while the remaining three were dropped by police.

title.children: NRL star had '15-20 alcoholic drinks' before groping woman in Sydney pub, court told

image.altText: A composite picture of Veronica Philomena Lockyer and her seven-month-old baby Adell Sherylee Partridge.

items.synopsis: It's been 25 years since Veronica Lockyer and her baby daughter vanished without trace on the outskirts of Perth, and now an inquest is trying to piece together the mystery.

title.children: What happened to Veronica and baby Adell? Coroner probes 25-year-old WA cold case mystery

image.altText: A composite image shows an older white man in a suit on the left and a younger white man not wearing a suit on the right.

items.synopsis: Pat Sajak will host Wheel of Fortune's upcoming season, the show's 41st, before Ryan Seacrest kicks off a multi-year deal starting with season 42.

title.children: Ryan Seacrest announced as new US host of Wheel of Fortune, replacing Pat Sajak

image.altText: A feral cat lying on the ground snarling at the camera.

items.synopsis: A deadly new tool is being rolled out that will kill feral cats by spraying them with a toxic gel, as part of a five-year plan to reduce the enormous impact the predators are having on native wildlife.

title.children: Deadly tool that sprays feral cats with toxic gel unveiled as part of Australia-first strategy to save wildlife

image.altText: An alleged Australian-built cardboard drone lies nose down with a twig stuck in it

items.synopsis: Photos appear online purporting to show an Australian-made drone that recently crashed inside Russian territory with an explosive strapped to it.

title.children: Pro-Putin military bloggers claim Australian-built cardboard drone was brought down inside Russia

image.altText: Two brown cows

items.synopsis: New research shows a 65 per cent carbon emissions reduction in the industry since 2005 but a lot more investment will be needed if the sector is going to reach its carbon neutral target by 2030.

title.children: Red meat sector's target of net zero emissions is 'ambitious' and needs 'more investment'

image.altText: A muddy four wheel drive.

items.synopsis: South Australian road trippers on their way to the Big Red Bash in Birdsville are left stranded with the Birdsville Track in the state's far north forced to close due to heavy rain.

title.children: Birdsville Track closure leaves Big Red Bash goers stranded

image.altText: An octogenarian white man in a brown hat and jacket stands in a town square with a white brunette woman in a white hat and shirt

items.synopsis: Taking over the reins from George Lucas and Steven Spielberg, director James Mangold had his work cut out for him bringing this four-decade story to a close. Did he succeed?

title.children: Harrison Ford gracefully ends 40 years of Indiana Jones, with Phoebe Waller-Bridge as sidekick

image.altText: Sydney gay hate murders

items.synopsis: An inquiry into suspected unsolved deaths suspected of being gay hate crimes has heard NSW Police sought to discredit a coroner's finding that the deaths of three men in Bondi in the 1980s was likely murder.

title.children: Police deliberately refused to investigate Bondi deaths as gay hate crimes, inquiry told

image.altText: A woman lifts a tennis trophy in triumph.

items.synopsis: The governing body for women's tennis announces a new circuit structure designed to ensure equal prize money for men and women by 2027.

title.children: WTA announces plan towards equal pay for men's and women's circuits by 2027
